description: This file defines the class cConfig for managing the configuration of Linux containers, including generating various parts of the lxc.conf file, handling filesystem setup, network configurations, security settings, and other container parameters. It also interacts with other components such as dbus, cgroup, logging, and rootfs to assemble the complete container configuration.

classes.name: cConfig
classes.description: Represents container configuration, implements functionalities to generate the lxc.conf file and manage container filesystem, network, security, and other settings.

methods.name: __init__(self, sanityCheck, rootfs, privileged, append, prevUserName, prevGroupName)
methods.description: Initializes cConfig instance with container parameters such as sanity check object, root filesystem, privilege status, append mode, and previous user/group names.

methods.name: processUsersAndGroups(self, lxcParamsNode, lxcConfigNode, allUserNames, allGroupNames)
methods.description: Processes user and group configurations from lxcConfigNode and updates allUserNames and allGroupNames dictionaries accordingly, creating user/group entries if needed.

methods.name: createEnvConf(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Creates environment variable configurations for the container based on the lxcConfigNode.

methods.name: createNetworkConf(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Generates network interface configurations for the container.

methods.name: createMountPoint(self, type, path, source)
methods.description: Creates filesystem mount points within the rootfs based on specified type, path, and source.

methods.name: getAutodevSettings(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Determines autodev settings and generates corresponding configuration entries.

methods.name: getAutodevHookSettings(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Retrieves autodev hook configuration if specified.

methods.name: generateMountPoints(self, mountPointNode)
methods.description: Generates and creates all mount points as specified in the mountPointNode.

methods.name: moveContent(self, moveContentNode)
methods.description: Moves files or directories within the root filesystem according to moveContentNode.

methods.name: generateLibMountPoints(self, libBindingsNode)
methods.description: Generates and sets up library bind mounts from the specified node.

methods.name: generateHardlinks(self, libHardlinksNode)
methods.description: Creates hard links for libraries specified in libHardlinksNode.

methods.name: createRootfsConf(self, rootfsNode)
methods.description: Creates root filesystem configuration, including mount points and moving content.

methods.name: genereteUserSettings(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Generates user and group IDs for the container if privileges are granted.

methods.name: generateCapsSettings(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Generates Linux capability drop and keep settings.

methods.name: createSeccompConf(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Creates seccomp profile configuration for container security.

methods.name: createLxcConf(self, lxcConfigNode)
methods.description: Main method to generate the complete lxc.conf file, incorporating cgroup, security, network, environment, and other container configurations.

ctags.name: __init__
ctags.pattern: /^    def __init__(self, sanityCheck, rootfs, privileged, append, prevUserName, prevGroupName):$/
ctags.signature: (self, sanityCheck, rootfs, privileged, append, prevUserName, prevGroupName)

ctags.name: processUsersAndGroups
ctags.pattern: /^    def processUsersAndGroups(self, lxcParamsNode, lxcConfigNode, allUserNames, allGroupNames):$/
